snippet: President Obama has more latitude on immigration than he lets on, experts say, and officials are weighing options to further shift enforcement to focus on criminals and recent border crossers.
abstract: Pres Obama has more latitude on immigration than he lets on, experts say, and he may soon reveal how he intends to use it; under increasing pressure to slow the pace of deportations from Hispanic supporters who helped get him re-elected in 2012, he has ordered his Homeland Security secretary to make immigration enforcement more humane.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama has more latitude on immigration than he lets on, experts say, and officials are weighing options to further shift enforcement to focus on criminals and recent border crossers.

headline.main: In the White House, Debating How Far to Go in Easing Deportations
headline.print_headline: In the White House, Debating How Far to Go in Easing Deportations
